src/core/layout.js
content:
/**
 * A binary pattern that describes the standard octant layout:
 *
 * ```text
 *    3____7
 *  2/___6/|
 *  | 1__|_5
 *  0/___4/
 * ```
 *
 * This common layout is crucial for positional assumptions.
 *
 * @type {Uint8Array[]}
 */

export const layout = [

	new Uint8Array([0, 0, 0]),
	new Uint8Array([0, 0, 1]),
	new Uint8Array([0, 1, 0]),
	new Uint8Array([0, 1, 1]),

	new Uint8Array([1, 0, 0]),
	new Uint8Array([1, 0, 1]),
	new Uint8Array([1, 1, 0]),
	new Uint8Array([1, 1, 1])

];

name: layout
description:
A binary pattern that describes the standard octant layout:

```text
   3____7
 2/___6/|
 | 1__|_5
 0/___4/
```

This common layout is crucial for positional assumptions.

name: raycast
description:
Finds the nodes that intersect with the given ray. The intersecting
nodes are sorted by distance, closest first.

params.name: intersects
params.description: An optional target list to be filled with the intersecting nodes.

name: leaves
description:
Returns an iterator that traverses the octree and returns leaf nodes.

When a cull region is provided, the iterator will only return leaves that
intersect with that region.

name: [Symbol.iterator]
description: Returns an iterator that traverses the octree and returns all leaf nodes.

name: src/points/PointOctant.js
p
description: A point.

name: PointOctant
description: An octant that maintains points.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new point octant.

name: points
description: The points.

name: data
description: Point data.

name: distanceToSquared
description: Calculates the distance squared from this octant to the given point.

name: distanceToCenterSquared
description:
Calculates the distance squared from the center of this octant to the given
point.

name: contains
description:
Checks if the given point lies inside this octant's boundaries.

This method can also be used to check if this octant intersects a sphere by
providing a radius as bias.

params.name: bias
params.description: A padding that extends the boundaries temporarily.

return.description: Whether the given point lies inside this octant.

name: redistribute
description:
Redistributes the points of this octant to its children.

Has no effect if there are no points or if this octant has no children.

name: merge
description: Deletes all child nodes and collects their points.

name: src/points/PointOctree.js
countPoints
description: Recursively counts how many points are in the given octant.

name: insert
description: Recursively inserts a point into the octree.

params.name: data
params.description: An object that the point represents.

name: remove
description: Recursively finds a point in the octree and removes it.

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent of the current octant.

return.description: The data entry of the removed point or null if it didn't exist.

name: get
description: Recursively finds a point in the octree and fetches the associated data.

return.description: The data entry that is associated with the given point or null if it doesn't exist.

name: move
description: Recursively moves an existing point to a new position.

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent of the current octant.

return.description: The data entry of the updated point or null if it didn't exist.

description: Recursively finds the closest point to the given one.

params.name: skipSelf
params.description: Whether a point that is exactly at the given position should be skipped.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The data that belongs to the point.

properties.name: distance
properties.description: The distance to the given point.

return.description: An object representing the nearest point or null if there is none.

name: findPoints
description:
Recursively finds points that are inside the specified radius around a given
position.

params.name: skipSelf
params.description: Whether a point that is exactly at the given position should be skipped.

params.name: result
params.description: An array to be filled with objects.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The data that belongs to the point.

name: PointOctree
description: An octree that manages points.

name: constructor
description: Constructs a new point octree.

params.name: min
params.description: The lower bounds of the tree.

params.name: max
params.description: The upper bounds of the tree.

params.name: bias
params.description: An octant boundary bias. The octree is considered "loose" with a bias greater than 0.

params.name: maxPoints
params.description: Number of distinct points per octant before it splits up.

params.name: maxDepth
params.description: The maximum tree depth level, starting at 0.

name: bias
description: An octant boundary bias.

name: maxPoints
description:
The number of points per octant before a split occurs.

This value works together with the maximum depth as a secondary limiting
factor. Smaller values cause splits to occur earlier which results in a
faster and deeper tree growth.

name: maxDepth
description:
The maximum tree depth level.

It's possible to use Infinity, but keep in mind that allowing infinitely
small octants can have a severely negative impact on performance.
Finding a value that works best for a specific scene is advisable.

name: pointCount
description: The amount of points that are currently in this octree.

name: countPoints
description: Counts how many points are in the given octant.

name: insert
description: Puts a point into the octree.

params.name: point
params.description: A point. If it's already in the octree, the data entry will be updated.

params.name: data
params.description: A data object that belongs to the point.

name: remove
description: Removes a point from the tree.

return.description: The data entry of the removed point or null if it didn't exist.

name: get
description: Retrieves the data of the specified point.

return.description: The data entry that is associated with the given point or null if it doesn't exist.

name: move
description:
Moves an existing point to a new position. Has no effect if the point
doesn't exist.

return.description: The data entry of the updated point or null if it didn't exist.

name: findNearestPoint
description: Finds the closest point to the given one.

params.name: maxDistance
params.description: An upper limit for the distance between the points.

params.name: skipSelf
params.description: Whether a point that is exactly at the given position should be skipped.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The data that belongs to the point.

properties.name: distance
properties.description: The distance to the given point.

return.description: An object representing the nearest point or null if there is none.

name: findPoints
description: Finds points that are in the specified radius around the given position.

params.name: skipSelf
params.description: Whether a point that is exactly at the given position should be skipped.

properties.name: data
properties.description: The data that belongs to the point.

name: raycast
description: Finds the points that intersect with the given ray.

params.name: intersects
params.description: An array to be filled with the intersecting points.

name: src/raycasting/findEntryOctant.js
findEntryOctant
description:
Finds the entry plane of the first octant that a ray travels through.

Determining the first octant requires knowing which of the t0s is the
largest. The tms of the other axes must also be compared against that
largest t0.

return.description: The index of the first octant that the ray travels through.

name: src/raycasting/findNextOctant.js
octantTable
description:
A lookup-table containing octant ids. Used to determine the exit plane from
an octant.

name: findNextOctant
description:
Finds the next octant that intersects with the ray based on the exit plane of
the current one.

params.name: currentOctant
params.description: The index of the current octant.

return.description: The index of the next octant that the ray travels through.

description: Calculates ray projection parameters for the given octree and ray setup.

flags

name: raycastOctant
description: Finds all octants that intersect with the given ray.

params.name: intersects
params.description: An array to be filled with the intersecting octants.

name: OctreeRaycaster
description:
A raycaster for pointer-based octrees.

Reference:
 "An Efficient Parametric Algorithm for Octree Traversal"
 by J. Revelles et al. (2000)

name: intersectOctree
description: Finds (pseudo) leaf octants that intersect with the given ray.

params.name: intersects
params.description: An optional target list to be filled with the intersecting octants.

return.description: The intersecting octants. Sorted by distance, closest first.

name: ./README.md

content:
{
	"name": "sparse-octree",
	"version": "6.0.1",
	"description": "A sparse octree data structure.",
	"homepage": "https://github.com/vanruesc/sparse-octree",
	"main": "build/sparse-octree.js",
	"module": "build/sparse-octree.esm.js",
	"sideEffects": false,
	"license": "Zlib",

	"keywords": [
		"partition",
		"hierarchy",
		"subdivision",
		"raycasting",
		"3d",
		"spatial",
		"voxel",
		"points",
		"frustum",
		"culling",
		"pointer"
	],

	"author": {
		"name": "Raoul van Rschen",
		"email": "vanruesc@outlook.de"
	},

	"repository": {
		"type": "git",
		"url": "https://github.com/vanruesc/sparse-octree.git"
	},

	"bugs": {
		"url": "https://github.com/vanruesc/sparse-octree/issues"
	},

	"files": ["build"],

	"scripts": {
		"ava": "ava",
		"lint": "npm run lint:lib && npm run lint:demo && npm run lint:test",
		"lint:config": "eslint *.js",
		"lint:lib": "eslint src",
		"lint:demo": "eslint demo/src",
		"lint:test": "eslint test",
		"build": "rollup -c",
		"build:production": "cross-env NODE_ENV=production npm run build",
		"watch": "rollup -c --watch",
		"doc": "rimraf public/docs && esdoc",
		"pretest": "npm run lint && npm run build:production",
		"test": "npm run ava",
		"prepack": "npm test"
	},

	"ava": {
		"failFast": true,
		"files": ["test/**/*.js"]
	},

	"eslintConfig": {
		"extends": "delta"
	},

	"peerDependencies": {
		"iterator-result": ">= 0.0.0 < 1.0.0",
		"math-ds": ">= 1.0.0 < 2.0.0"
	},

	"devDependencies": {
		"@babel/core": "7.x.x",
		"@babel/preset-env": "7.x.x",
		"ava": "2.x.x",
		"cross-env": "6.x.x",
		"dat.gui": "0.x.x",
		"delta-controls": "2.x.x",
		"esdoc": "1.x.x",
		"esdoc-importpath-plugin": "1.x.x",
		"esdoc-standard-plugin": "1.x.x",
		"eslint": "6.x.x",
		"eslint-config-delta": "1.x.x",
		"iterator-result": "0.x.x",
		"math-ds": "1.x.x",
		"rimraf": "3.x.x",
		"octree-helper": "1.x.x",
		"rollup": "1.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-babel": "4.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-babel-minify": "9.x.x",
		"rollup-plugin-node-resolve": "5.x.x",
		"synthetic-event": "1.x.x",
		"three": "0.x.x",
		"three-demo": "3.x.x"
	}
}
name: package.json
